body: @RalphSu could you plz help to review?

What's the relationship of this ticket with #546 ?
removed the unused code after code review
The Root cause is the stream router bolt bug miss a case that should be multiple policy references the same stream with same group (one of them is a multiple input stream policy).
close this one, will create another pr for this.

@garrettlish the implementation looks a little confusing.

Please just simply use kafka configs: https://kafka.apache.org/08/documentation.html#clientconfig, and here is another code using async kafka producer: https://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle/blob/master/eagle-core/eagle-app/eagle-app-base/src/main/java/org/apache/eagle/app/sink/KafkaStreamSink.java#L53-L57

# kafka properties

```
producer.type = async
batch.num.messages = 3000
queue.buffering.max.ms  = 5000
queue.buffering.max.messages = 10000
```

The convention here:

we will have these properties as part of publishment and need to avoid "." in key, since mongo store doesn't support "." in key, use "_" instead.

There would be many configuration for kafka, let us focus on above properties, and request.required.acks one in this PR.

The configuration is ok. The primary concern here is the `async` implementation, kafka producer natively support `async` mode, so that you just need pass through it instead of handle `async` thread manually which will look not very clean.

BTW: these selected `4` config keys are what we have evaluated in real-case for `async kafka producer` and impact kafka throughput mostly, instead of requiring you guys to include many additional kafka configurations :-)

```
producer.type = async
batch.num.messages = 3000
queue.buffering.max.ms  = 5000
queue.buffering.max.messages = 10000
```

The default value is just for example :-).

And when using kafka producer `async` mode and throughput becomes extremely larger, batch size is one of the most important configurations for tuning.
Yes, cool, then we can keep the current implementation and override the batch size configuration in publish properties kafka_client_config :-)

POST   http://localhost:9090/rest/metadata/alerts/batch  
GET     http://localhost:9090/rest/metadata/alerts?size=xxx
